document.heading: PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO COUNCIL RESOLUTION NO. SI-R24-003
The BIA P.L. 93-638 Contract Authorization Act
document.preamble: At a duly called meeting of the Council of San Ildefonso Pueblo on the 18th day of April, 2024, the following Resolution and law were adopted:

recital.text: the Pueblo de San Ildefonso ("Pueblo") is a sovereign and self-governing Tribe, recognized as such by the United States of America; and,

the Pueblo has contracted and administered various programs and services provided by the Bureau of Indian Affairs ("BIA") through contracts with the BIA pursuant to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act ("ISDEAA"), also known as P.L. 93-638 ("638" contracts); and,
the Pueblo is required to apply to BIA for initial "638" contracts as well as for renewal of on-going "638" contracts; and,
a Council resolution or authorization is required for the "638" contract application and its submission to BIA; and,

the Pueblo acknowledges the benefits received from the services provided by the various "638" contracted programs and wishes to continue to contract with BIA to receive funding to administer these programs; and,

the Council has determined that it is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to contract with the BIA for programs and services that are beneficial to the Pueblo without the need to continually return to the Council for a resolution or authorization for the "638" contract, particularly for a renewal of an existing contract; and,

the Council has determined that is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to negotiate and execute a contract agreement and to take any other actions necessary to effectuate a contract for the following BIA-contracted programs:
the Council intends that this authorization shall remain in effect until rescinded by the Council.
that the Council hereby enacts the attached law entitled "THE BIA P.L. 93-638 CONTRACT AUTHORIZATION ACT."

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on April 18, 2024, at a meeting with a vote of 9 in favor, 0 opposed, 0 abstaining and 1 absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

container.heading: The BIA P.L. 93-638 Contract Authorization Act

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R24-003

attachment.heading: THE BIA P.L. 93-638 CONTRACT AUTHORIZATION ACT

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "THE BIA P.L. 93-638 CONTRACT AUTHORIZATION ACT" ("Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this Act to authorize the Governor to contract with the BIA for programs and services that are beneficial to the Pueblo without the need to return to the Council for a resolution or authorization for the "638" contract, particularly for a renewal of an existing "638" contract.

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Council hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: The Pueblo de San Ildefonso ("Pueblo") contracted and administered various programs and services provided by the Bureau of Indian Affairs ("BIA") through contracts with the BIA pursuant to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act ("ISDEAA"), also known as P.L. 93-638 ("638 contracts").
The Pueblo is required to apply to BIA for initial "638" contracts as well as for renewal of on-going "638" contracts.
A Council resolution or authorization is required for the "638" contract application and its submission to BIA.

The Pueblo acknowledges the benefits received from the services provided by the various "638" contracted programs and wishes to continue to contract with BIA to receive funding to administer these programs.

The Council has determined that it is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to contract with the BIA for programs and services that are beneficial to the Pueblo without the need to continually return to the Council for a resolution or authorization for the "638" contract, particularly for a renewal of an existing contract.

The Council has determined that is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to negotiate and execute a contract agreement and to take any other actions necessary to effectuate a contract for the following BIA-contracted programs:
Consolidated Tribal Government Program
Indian Child Welfare Act Program
Johnson O'Malley Program
Scholarships Program
The Council intends that this authorization shall remain in effect until rescinded by the Council.

The Governor is authorized to contract with the BIA for programs and services that are beneficial to the Pueblo without the need to return to the Council for a resolution or authorization for the "638" contract, particularly if it is for a renewal of an existing contract.
The Governor is authorized to negotiate and execute a contract agreement and to take any other actions necessary to effectuate a contract for the following BIA-contracted programs:
Consolidated Tribal Government Program
Indian Child Welfare Act Program
Johnson O'Malley Program
Scholarships Program

The Governor is also authorized to negotiate and execute a new contract agreement for any other BIA program not listed in Section 1.4(b) above, and upon issuance of a "638" contract by BIA, such program shall be subject to the continuing authorization of this Act.

In the event that BIA requires a specific resolution or other authorization for a "638" contract, the Governor is authorized to issue a form of resolution or authorization in accordance with the Pueblo's Grant Authorization Act.
When a "638" contract application or agreement has been submitted to BIA under the authorizations of this Act, the Governor shall notify the Council of such submission at the next Council meeting.
This authorization shall remain in effect until rescinded by the Council.
